benefit: Lower body strength, Core engagement, Improved athletic performance

beginner.description: Bodyweight squats focusing on proper form. We can use a chair for assisted squats if needed.

advanced.description: We can progress to weighted squats with dumbbells or kettlebells once you're comfortable with bodyweight squats.

form.feet: Shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward
form.knees: Track over your toes, don't let them cave in
form.back: Keep your core engaged and back straight, avoid hunching
form.depth: Lower yourself as if sitting back into a chair, aiming for thighs parallel to the floor
form.movement: Push through your heels to stand back up

progression: We'll increase the weight, sets, or reps as you get stronger.

safety.listen: Listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain.
safety.focus: Focus on quality form over heavy weights.
safety.warm-up: Don't forget to warm up with some light cardio and dynamic stretches before squatting.

step.benefit: Improved mobility, Full-body stretch, Dynamic warmup

basic.description: Start standing and then reach down to touch your toes. Walk your hands forward until you're in a high plank position. Then, walk your feet up to meet your hands and return to standing.

safety.listen: Listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain.
safety.modifications: If reaching your toes is difficult, keep your knees slightly bent. You can also perform this exercise on your forearms for a less intense stretch on your hamstrings.

step.benefit: Upper body strength, Core engagement, Improves posture

beginner.description: Start in a high plank position with hands shoulder-width apart, core engaged, and back straight. Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows. Keep your elbows tucked in close to your body. Push back up to starting position.
beginner.modifications: If push-ups on your toes are too difficult, you can perform them on your knees instead.

advanced.description: Once you can comfortably perform push-ups on your toes, you can progress to decline push-ups (feet elevated on a bench or chair) or diamond push-ups (hands close together forming a diamond shape).

safety.listen: Listen to your body and stop if you feel any pain in your shoulders or wrists.
safety.form: Focus on maintaining proper form throughout the exercise. Don't let your back sag or hips hike up.
safety.warm-up: Don't forget to warm up with some light cardio and arm circles before push-ups.
